result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke James Blackley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 5712 W State Hwy 33, Portage marked "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."

Cases called: 14CF393, 15CF220 & 15CF438, Defendant Luke James Blackley in court with attorney David Karpe. Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Court explained read in and dismissed to the defendant. Defendant pled guilty to count 2 in 15CF220.  Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, ordered a PSI to be done. Count 1 read in and dismissed. 14CF393 & 15CF438 read in and dismissed. Argued sentencing to be set once PSI received.
standard felony conditions
copy of District Attorney's office letter to dispatch canceling warrant

Defendant Luke James Blackley in court, in custody by video with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. defendant appearing on warrant, waives reading, right to atty recited, $100.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, waives time limits to prelim,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 09:00 am.
